Package KI305_Leshkovych_Lab4

Class ExpressionCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • KI305_Leshkovych_Lab4.ExpressionCalculator
  • public class ExpressionCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for calculating the expression y = (x - 4) / sin(3 * x - 1).

    This class provides methods to calculate the mathematical expression based on the input value of x and write the result to a file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExpressionCalculator

    • Method Detail

      • calculate

        public double calculate​(double x)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to calculate the expression y = (x - 4) / sin(3 * x - 1).

        This method computes the result of the given mathematical expression. If the value of sin(3 * x - 1) is 0, it throws an IllegalArgumentException since division by zero is undefined.

        Parameters:
        x - the value of the variable x.
        Returns:
        the result of the calculation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if sin(3 * x - 1) is 0.

      • writeResultToFile

        public void writeResultToFile​(double result)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Method to write the result to a file.

        This method automatically creates a file named "result.txt" and writes the calculation result to it. If an error occurs during file writing, it throws an IOException.

        Parameters:
        result - the result of the calculation.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while writing to the file.
